title: 41 Dead After Riot Erupts in Honduran Women’s Prison
description: The inmates were found shot or burned to death in the latest spasm of violence in the country’s troubled prison system.

title: Russia Sends Attack Drones Across Ukraine, Targeting Kyiv and Lviv
description: Moscow’s forces also shot and killed a rescue worker in the flood-stricken city of Kherson, Ukrainian officials said, as both sides battled for territory in the south and east.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: The Search for the Missing Titanic Sub
description: Also, a shake-up at Alibaba and a taste of Singapore’s street food.

title: When Submersibles Meet the Titanic, James Cameron Is an Inspiration
description: Cameron’s 1997 movie “Titanic” reinvigorated interest in the ill-fated ocean liner, feeding the mystique that spurs some wealthy experience chasers.

title: Palestinian Gunmen Kill 4 Israeli Civilians in Occupied West Bank
description: Two Hamas members carried out the attack outside Eli, a settlement in the northern West Bank, before being shot dead themselves.

title: Foreign Spies a ‘Serious Threat’ to Germany, Intelligence Agency Says
description: The agency said that the country was a growing target for countries like Russia and China amid rising tensions over the war in Ukraine and rivalry between Washington and Beijing.

title: French Police Search Paris Olympics Offices in Corruption Investigation
description: French prosecutors said they were investigating potential conflicts of interest, embezzlement and favoritism connected to public contracts signed by organizers of the Games.

title: Site Where Julius Caesar Was Killed Is Opened For Tourism
description: The site where the emperor was assassinated by a group of senators in 44 B.C., nestled among four ancient temples, has been opened to the public for the first time in a century.

title: E.U. Takes Aim at China in Proposed Economic Strategy
description: A European Commission plan seeks to ban companies from sending sensitive high-tech goods to potentially hostile countries — without naming any names.

title: 1948: Paris ‘Métro’ Gets New Name, But Subway-Goers Won’t Use It
description: With an eye toward expansion, the company in charge of the French capital’s transport system will be renamed.

title: Andrew Tate Will Face Human Trafficking Trial in Romania
description: Prosecutors in the country announced an indictment against the antagonistic online personality known for his misogynistic remarks. He had been under house arrest outside Bucharest.

title: Russia Targets Kyiv and Lviv in Overnight Strikes
description: Most of the drones and missiles were intercepted. Lviv, in western Ukraine, is far from the front line, where Ukraine’s military is making small gains in its counteroffensive.

title: Republicans Against Inequality
description: We’re covering a new breed of Republicans, a missing submersible near the Titanic and Judge Judy’s new TV empire.

title: Rescuers Race to Find Missing Crew Near Titanic Wreck as Air Supply Dwindles
description: A submersible with five people on board went missing in the North Atlantic on Sunday and has only a few days’ worth of life support.

title: What to Know About the Search for the Missing Titan Submersible
description: U.S. and Canadian crews are searching for the 22-foot vessel that set off on Sunday morning with five people on board to explore the Titanic shipwreck site off Newfoundland — and hasn’t been heard from since.

title: Blinken Visit Reveals Chasm in How U.S. and China Perceive Rivalry
description: Xi Jinping and nationalistic Chinese see recent U.S. actions as an effort to contain another superpower rather than compete with it — and they’re pushing back.

title: Freed Ukrainian P.O.W.s Report Abuses in Russian Captivity
description: Ukrainian captives released in prisoner exchanges say that beatings were common, and that they suffered from woefully inadequate health care and food.

title: Germany’s Far Right AfD Party Stages a Comeback
description: With Germans facing an era of political and economic turbulence, the Alternative for Germany is resurgent. Mainstream politicians are struggling to respond.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: The aftermath of a devastating shipwreck in Greece.

title: Rising Temperatures Speeding Up Himalayan Glacier Loss
description: Glaciers in the region melted faster between 2010 and 2019 than in the previous decade. “Things are just happening so fast,” one researcher said.
